review: I haven't used any other streaming devices before, so can't make any comparison. As a college student who does not have a stable income, I think it worth the price. It has all the feature I need with a cheaper price comparing to Amazon Fire TV Box or Roku, even though on day 1 the sys stopped responding for 2-3 times and the remote control reacts slow sometimes. And I'm surprised that Amazon Fire TV Stick CAN actually wirelessly mirror my Win10 laptop screen! I heard complains from other people saying Amazon Fire TV Stick is not compatible with Windows sys. But it works fine with my laptop after I updated my sys from Win7 to Win10. Now I can watch anime with my roomies on a bigger screen.P.s For those who cannot wirelessly mirror Win10 screen, check your laptop's compatibility first if you upgraded from Win7, then update all your Intel drivers and install Intel WiDi from Intel's website: http://www.intel.com/p/en_US/support/highlights/wireless/wireless-displayAnd be patient, it took me a whole afternoon to successfully pair the TV stick with my Win10 laptop. Updating Intel's driver is troublesome.
